alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Harvey; Kingman; Marion; McPherson; Reno; Rice; Sedgwick; Sumner; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 22 at 7:07AM CST until December 22 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Wilson County in southeastern Kansas... McPherson County in central Kansas... Reno County in south central Kansas... Butler County in south central Kansas... Eastern Kingman County in south central Kansas... Marion County in central Kansas... Sumner County in south central Kansas... Woodson County in southeastern Kansas... Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... Elk County in southeastern Kansas... Northern Cowley County in south central Kansas... Sedgwick County in south central Kansas... Harvey County in south central Kansas... Chase County in east central Kansas... Southern Rice County in central Kansas... * Until 800 AM CST. * At 705 AM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Americus to near West Wichita, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility as low as a quarter mile in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 69. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 9 and 116. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Hutchinson, Derby, Newton, Mcpherson, El Dorado, Winfield, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Wellington, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Goddard, Rose Hill, Hesston, Maize and Hillsboro. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Chase; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Harvey; Kingman; Marion; McPherson; Reno; Rice; Sedgwick; Sumner; Wilson; Woodson
